documents.document: 1,927,484 people in Scotland have been tested for #coronavirus The total confirmed as positive has risen by 139 to 226,644 The number of deaths of patients who tested positive remains at 7,660 Latest update https://t.co/bZPbrCoQux Health advice https://t.co/l7rqArB6Qu https://t.co/6z6XTxW99v

As restrictions ease, more workplaces and sectors are able to reopen. However we must all continue to work together to stop the spread of coronavirus and minimise new outbreaks. Employers, find guidance and download the FACTS toolkit on our website.

Know how to socialise safely. 6 people from 2 households can meet in certain indoor public places, like cafs or restaurants. 6 people from 6 households can meet outdoors. Do not meet people from other households inside their home or yours. Remember to follow FACTS.

Wherever you have travelled from, you must complete a Passenger Locator Form before you arrive. If you fail to complete the form, you are risking public health and could be fined. Read more https://t.co/jV0fDdzHFR https://t.co/EnZthmkHN3

Remember, it's illegal to travel overseas from Scotland unless it's for an essential reason. The situation in many countries can change suddenly, so you should only book international travel if its absolutely essential. https://t.co/7wakx4S9Ue

The #coronavirus restrictions in Scotland are easing from Monday 26 April. This includes the reopening of: cafs, pubs and restaurants tourist accommodation gyms, non-essential retail and close contact services like beauty salons Learn more https://t.co/kZjGNyL3eE https://t.co/dCDFS11YXi

From Monday 26 April, people travelling to Scottish islands are encouraged to take 2 #coronavirus tests before they travel. This helps stop the spread of the virus to our island communities. More information https://t.co/gESu0F5w0J https://t.co/2obi3HSqwj

From Monday 26 April, everyone in Scotland will be able to access rapid #coronavirus testing. Free lateral flow home test kits will be available for people without symptoms to test themselves twice a week. Read more about testing https://t.co/gESu0F5w0J https://t.co/oibzvFDq9Y

There will be a one minute silence at 3pm today to mark the death of His Royal Highness, The Duke of Edinburgh. Please do not travel to, or gather at, Royal Residences. https://t.co/DxG3lxnD2C

We all need to play our part to stop the spread. Outdoors, a maximum of 6 people from up to 6 households can socialise. Stay 2 metres apart. Do not meet people from other households inside their home or yours. Coronavirus hasn't gone away. Know how to stay safe

As the travel restrictions in Scotland are eased, we all need to remember to enjoy our countryside responsibly. Respect your surroundings and #StaySafe to protect yourself and others from #coronavirus. Make sure you know the rules https://t.co/kZjGNz2EDe https://t.co/XAtwB76lAs

You can now travel within Scotland for outdoor socialising, recreation and exercise. But remember: no overnight stays outside your local area for this you must #StayLocal for other reasons like non-essential shopping public transport capacity is still limited https://t.co/3Z4NgLEXrr

Tonight, Scottish Government buildings will glow yellow. This marks a National #DayOfReflection to show support for those who have lost loved ones. Join us by shining a light at 8pm. https://t.co/zkRb5TNYW8
